is a beach village of about 25.000 inhabitants in

. It has recently been discovered by European developers, and small resorts are popping up. Larger projects are in the pipeline, such as a golf course and a beach volleyball arena with a training camp for players. To the west you can see the modern and steadily growing port of
. With a steel mill and petroleum refinery to come, it promises a certain impact on the region.

value: To get anywhere else by bus, you need to go to the center of nearby
can be negotiated at R$ 50-80, often included waiting time and return to Cumbuco same day.

You can walk mostly anywhere. The local taxi stand is one block west of the main square. Negotiate prices up front. Buggies can also be hired for short runs, but are mostly more expensive than cabs.

value: This is one of the best spots in the world for
. Several places rent equipment and give classes.Since 5 years Extreme Control Kiteboarding
(traditional fishing raft with sail) will take you a kilometer or so into the sea to give you a different view of the beach. Nice photos from out there. R$ 10 or less per person.
can be rented for a day for about R$ 150, -fits 3-4 passengers. It will take you to 2-3 different fresh water lakes for swimming, and also for a ride up and down some dunes.
and drive it yourself, but you will not have access to the dunes. It is nominally prohibited to drive on the beach, but this is not enforced.
to make sure that you disturb other people's beach experience.

Prices vary greatly. Lunch can be had from R$ 5 at a number of tiny local restaurants.

value: content=Good for breakfast and light lunch. Drinking in the evenings. Chill music
directions=Entrance to the village, on the right hand side.
content=Food and Lounge. Open evenings only, from Monday to Saturday. Happy Hour daily from 17.00 to 20.30.

What little action there is into the wee hours, all happens along the side streets of the main square:

value: content=International restaurant which is already a wellknown place for over 3 years. Nice ambiance and tasty food.
content=Open evenings only. International menu with strong Italian influence. Highly recommended.

Loads and loads of apartments for rent, mostly in the mid and upper range. Good deals can be found outside the peak and kiting seasons.

value: directions=200 m west of the main square.
content=Good restaurant, large pool area right at the beach. Larger rooms have kitchens.
directions=At the western outskirts of the village
content=Allegedly the largest hotel in the state, this is a full-scale resort. Golf course coming up next.

located in the small bakery at the east end of the village, just around the corner from the main square. It is open until around 6pm. The only other

in the area is at a gas station (open every day 7 AM - 10 PM, probably the only one ever seen selling kite surfing gear) some 25 minutes walk in the direction of Fortaleza. Any bus leaving from Cumbuco's main square passes by.
Slow internet in a couple of shops at R$ 2/hour.
